page.title: 05Farming
page.content: There are two types of farming prctised in the parish - dairy farming and beef. To begin with, the main product of the dairies was cheese, with butter making a minor trade. In the 1930's cheese making declined, and the opening of the creamery in Kirkcudbright in 1923 accelerated the chnge over from cheese making to the sale of liqiod milk. With present day EEC quotas for milk production, many farmers are putting off their dairy and turning to beef and sheep. The area is famous for its Galloway cattle, especially the Belted Galloway which is a very strong and sturdy beast that can be wintered outside. This breed originated on the exposed uplands of Galloway, and are eminately suited for converting rough grazing into lean meat. They are black or dun cattle, with a distinctive white belt.
